name: dear
trans: adj. 亲爱的；尊敬的；昂贵的

sentences.english: Dear Sir or Madam, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的先生或女士，…

sentences.english: Dear Mrs. Wilson, ...
sentences.chinese: 尊敬的威尔逊夫人，…

sentences.english: Dear Meg, ...
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的梅格，…

sentences.english: You're a lot like me, dear.
sentences.chinese: 你和我太像了，亲爱的。

detailed_translations.english: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
You can call someone dear as a sign of affection

name: well
trans: adj. 良好的；健康的；适宜的
adv. 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: James reads quite well for his age.
sentences.chinese: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说，他的阅读能力算不错了。

sentences.english: All the team played very well today.
sentences.chinese: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。

sentences.english: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。

sentences.english: The festival was very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 节庆活动组织得很好。

sentences.english: The concert went very well.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地
detailed_translations.english: in a successful or satisfactory way
healthy

name: of
trans: prep. 关于；属于；…的；由…组成的

sentences.english: the back of the house
sentences.chinese: 房子的后部

sentences.english: the last scene of the movie
sentences.chinese: 电影的最后一个场景

sentences.english: the end of the day
sentences.chinese: 一天的末了

sentences.english: to be proud of sth
sentences.chinese: 为某事自豪

detailed_translations.english: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from

name: soon
trans: adv. 快；不久，一会儿；立刻；宁愿

sentences.english: It will be dark soon.
sentences.chinese: 天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: David arrived sooner than I expected.
sentences.chinese: 戴维到得比我预料的快。

sentences.english: ‘Who?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough (= fairly soon ) .’
sentences.chinese: “谁？”“你很快就会知道的。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 快；不久，一会儿；立刻；宁愿
detailed_translations.english: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens

name: tell
trans: vt. 告诉，说；辨别；吩咐；断定
vi. 讲述；告发，泄密；识别

sentences.english: I’ll tell you all about it when I get back.
sentences.chinese: 我回来再告诉你这一切。

sentences.english: Sheppard was telling the truth .
sentences.chinese: 谢泼德说的是实话。

detailed_translations.english: if someone tells you something, they communicate information, a story, their feelings etc to you

detailed_translations.chinese: (Tell)人名；(英、德、瑞典)特尔；(罗、意)泰尔；(阿拉伯)塔勒

name: love
trans: n. 恋爱；亲爱的；酷爱；喜爱的事物；爱情，爱意；疼爱；热爱；爱人，所爱之物
v. 爱，热爱；爱戴；赞美，称赞；喜爱；喜好；喜欢；爱慕

sentences.english: I love you, Tracy.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，特雷西。

sentences.english: He was the only man she had ever loved.
sentences.chinese: 他是她唯一爱过的男人。

sentences.english: What these kids need is love and support.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要的是关心和支持。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong feeling of  affection  for someone, combined with sexual attraction
a strong feeling of caring about someone, especially a member of your family or a close friend

name: skirt
trans: vt. 绕过，回避；位于…边缘

sentences.english: She wore a white blouse and a plain black skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着白衬衣和纯黑的裙子。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of outer clothing worn by women and girls, which hangs down from the waist like the bottom part of a dress
to avoid talking about an important subject, especially because it is difficult or embarrassing – used to show disapproval

name: clean
trans: adj. 清洁的，干净的；清白的

sentences.english: Are your hands clean?
sentences.chinese: 你的手干净吗？

sentences.english: clean towels
sentences.chinese: 干净的毛巾

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the wound clean .
sentences.chinese: 一定要保持伤口清洁。

sentences.english: Wipe that sink clean when you’re done.
sentences.chinese: 洗完后将水槽擦干净。

sentences.english: As usual, she left her room clean and tidy before going to school.
sentences.chinese: 和往常一样，她去上学之前把房间收拾得干干净净。

sentences.english: a spotlessly clean kitchen
sentences.chinese: 一尘不染的厨房

sentences.english: Oh, don’t get mad - it’s just good clean fun !
sentences.chinese: 噢，不要生气——这不过是个正经的玩笑嘛！

detailed_translations.english: without any dirt, marks etc

name: finish
trans: n. 结束；完美；回味（葡萄酒）

sentences.english: You can’t go anywhere until you’ve finished your homework.
sentences.chinese: 没完成家庭作业前你哪儿也不能去。

sentences.english: Have you finished that book yet?
sentences.chinese: 那本书你看完了吗？

sentences.english: ‘How’s the decorating going?’ ‘We’ve nearly finished.’
sentences.chinese: “装修进行得怎么样了？”“差不多快完成了。”

sentences.english: The football season finishes in May.
sentences.chinese: 足球赛季在 5 月份结束。

sentences.english: a dramatic finish to the race
sentences.chinese: 赛跑的戏剧性结局

detailed_translations.english: to complete the last part of something that you are doing
the end or last part of something

name: dirty
trans: adj. 下流的，卑鄙的；肮脏的；恶劣的；暗淡的

sentences.english: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
sentences.chinese: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子

sentences.english: How did you get so dirty?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

sentences.english: kids telling dirty jokes
sentences.chinese: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人

sentences.english: a dirty magazine
sentences.chinese: 色情杂志

detailed_translations.english: covered in or marked by an unwanted substance

name: paint
trans: vt. 油漆；绘画；装饰；涂色于；描绘；（用语言，文字等）描写；擦脂粉等
vi. 油漆；描绘；绘画；化妆
n. 油漆；颜料，涂料；绘画作品；胭脂等化妆品；色彩，装饰

sentences.english: The ceiling needs painting.
sentences.chinese: 天花板需要粉刷了。

sentences.english: brightly paintedhouses
sentences.chinese: 粉刷得很亮丽的房屋

sentences.english: The living room was painted in pastel shades of pink and blue.
sentences.chinese: 起居室被漆成淡雅的粉色和蓝色。

detailed_translations.english: to put paint on a surface
to make a picture, design etc using paint

sentences.english: Mr White likes chatting up the girls.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生喜欢跟姑娘们搭讪。

sentences.english: This gave Mr White an opportunity of collecting his thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 这就给怀特先生一个使思想集中起来的机会。

sentences.english: Mr Brown and his wife corresponded for many years before they met.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生与妻子在相识以前先通信了好多年。

sentences.english: Much of his work is done by phone .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作大部分是通过电话进行的。

sentences.english: Who was that on the phone ?
sentences.chinese: 谁来的电话？

sentences.english: I wish Amy would get off the phone .
sentences.chinese: 我真希望埃米别再打电话了。

detailed_translations.english: a telephone

sentences.english: We shall dress the hall up for the National Day.
sentences.chinese: 我们要把大厅布置一新过国庆节。

sentences.english: I give you a special blessing to have it every minute per second gives you health， happiness and good luck and I hope that this is the best that you spend the National Day!
sentences.chinese: 给你我特别的祝福，愿它每分每秒都带给你健康、好运和幸福，希望这是你度过的最美好的国庆节! 愿这短短的话语给你带来国庆的快乐!

sentences.english: My friends and I went to the Fragrant Mount on National Day.
sentences.chinese: 国庆节那天，我和我的朋友们一起去香山游玩。

name: stay
trans: vi. 停留；坚持；暂住；停下

sentences.english: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
sentences.chinese: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

sentences.english: She stayed late to finish the report.
sentences.chinese: 为了完成报告，她工作到很晚。

detailed_translations.english: to remain in a place rather than leave
a limited time of living in a place

name: what
trans: adv. 到什么程度，在哪一方面

sentences.english: Show me what you bought.
sentences.chinese: 给我看看你买的东西。

sentences.english: What he did was morally wrong.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为很缺德。

detailed_translations.english: the thing which

name: boring
trans: adj. 无聊的；令人厌烦的
v. 钻孔；使厌烦；挖空（bore的ing形式）

sentences.english: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。

sentences.english: The job was dull and boring.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的
detailed_translations.english: not interesting in any way

name: day
trans: adv. 每天；经常在白天地

sentences.english: We spent three days in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我们在巴黎度过了三天。

sentences.english: She only leaves her house during the day.
sentences.chinese: 她只在白天出门。

sentences.english: It was a cold blustery day.
sentences.chinese: 那是个寒风呼啸的冷天。

sentences.english: Kept in that dark cell, I could no longer tell whether it was day or night.
sentences.chinese: 我被关在那个漆黑的牢房里，不知是白天还是黑夜。

sentences.english: The day dawned (= started ) bright and clear.
sentences.chinese: 拂晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 24 hours

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: paper
trans: vi. 贴糊墙纸；发交通违章传票

sentences.english: I’ll get you a piece of paper so you can write the number down.
sentences.chinese: 我给你找张纸，你好把号码写下来。

sentences.english: Do you have a pen and paper?
sentences.chinese: 你有笔和纸吗？

sentences.english: the 1998 White Paper on political reform
sentences.chinese: 1998年政治改革白皮书

sentences.english: a paper on the Civil War
sentences.chinese: 一篇关于南北战争的论文

detailed_translations.english: material in the form of thin sheets that is used for writing on, wrapping things etc

name: important
trans: adj. 重要的，重大的；有地位的；有权力的

sentences.english: a very important meeting
sentences.chinese: 很重要的会议

sentences.english: The accident taught him an important lesson.
sentences.chinese: 那次事故给了他很大的教训。

sentences.english: Happiness is more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 快乐比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: ‘What did you say?’ ‘Oh, nothing important.’
sentences.chinese: “你说什么？”“噢，没什么大事。”

sentences.english: It’s vitally important that you understand the danger.
sentences.chinese: 了解危险所在是极为重要的。

sentences.english: a very important customer
sentences.chinese: 一位大客户

detailed_translations.english: an important event, decision, problem etc has a big effect or influence on people’s lives or on events in the future

sentences.english: the invention of printing
sentences.chinese: 印刷术的发明

sentences.english: the printing industry
sentences.chinese: 印刷业

sentences.english: a printing error
sentences.chinese: 印刷错误

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of making a book, magazine etc using a machine that puts ink onto paper

name: print
trans: n. 印刷业；印花布；印刷字体；印章；印记
vt. 印刷；打印；刊载；用印刷体写；在…印花样
vi. 印刷；出版；用印刷体写

sentences.english: Over five million copies of the paper are printed every day.
sentences.chinese: 这份报纸每日印量超过五百万。

sentences.english: When the book was first written no publisher would print it.
sentences.chinese: 这本书刚写成时没有出版商愿意出版。

sentences.english: There was no print at all on the backs of the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 门票背面没有印任何文字。

detailed_translations.english: to produce many printed copies of a book, newspaper etc
writing that has been printed, for example in books or newspapers

name: right
trans: adj. 正确的；直接的；右方的
adv. 正确地；恰当地；彻底地

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

sentences.english: He supplements his regular meals by eating between meals.
sentences.chinese: 他在两餐之间吃点东西来补充正餐。

sentences.english: The object of these experiments was to find the connection, if any, between the two phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 这些实验的目的就是探索这两种现象之间的联系，如果存在着任何联系的话。

sentences.english: Can James ride a bicycle yet?
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯会骑自行车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet

name: mouse
trans: n. 鼠标；老鼠；胆小羞怯的人

sentences.english: The cat laid a dead mouse at my feet.
sentences.chinese: 猫把一只死老鼠放在我的脚边。

sentences.english: a field mouse
sentences.chinese: 田鼠

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼠标；老鼠；胆小羞怯的人
detailed_translations.english: a small furry animal with a pointed nose and a long tail that lives in people’s houses or in fields

name: beside
trans: prep. 在旁边；与…相比；和…无关

sentences.english: Wendy came up and sat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed
sentences.chinese: 床边的桌子

sentences.english: I was standing right beside her at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

name: man
trans: n. 人；男人；人类；丈夫；雇工
vt. 操纵；给…配置人员；使增强勇气；在…就位

sentences.english: There were two men and a woman in the car.
sentences.chinese: 车上有两男一女。

sentences.english: He’s a very kind man.
sentences.chinese: 他是个非常和蔼的人。

sentences.english: a man’s watch
sentences.chinese: 男式手表

sentences.english: All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
sentences.chinese: 法律面前人人平等。

sentences.english: This is one of the worst diseases known to man.
sentences.chinese: 这是人类已知最严重的疾病之一。

detailed_translations.english: an adult male human

sentences.english: We all went except him.
sentences.chinese: 除他以外， 我们都去了。

sentences.english: He slipped into his coat and went out.
sentences.chinese: 他敏捷地套上外衣，跑到外面去了。

sentences.english: We went in company.
sentences.chinese: 我们一起去的。

name: saw
trans: vi. 锯；用锯；将某物锯成小块
vt. 看见；明白，了解；锯；锯成；锯开

sentences.english: The only tools in the house are a hammer and a saw.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里仅有的工具是一把锤子和一把锯。

sentences.english: She was in the back yard sawing logs.
sentences.chinese: 她在后院锯木头。

detailed_translations.english: a tool that you use for cutting wood. It has a flat blade with an edge cut into many V shapes.
to cut something using a saw

name: trip
trans: vi. 绊倒；远足；犯错误；轻快地走

sentences.english: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (= a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose ) . Mr Burgess has already left.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你是白来一趟了，伯吉斯先生已经走了。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 他无法前去领奖。

detailed_translations.english: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose
to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall

name: took
trans: v. 拿；取；接受（take的过去式）

name: fifty
trans: n. 五十；五十个；编号为50的东西
adj. 五十的；五十个的；众多的

sentences.english: Standards of living rose in the fifties.
sentences.chinese: 50年代生活水平提高了。

detailed_translations.english: the number 50

name: minute
trans: n. 分，分钟；片刻，一会儿；备忘录，笔记；会议记录
adj. 微小的，详细的 [maɪˈnjuːt; US -ˈnuːt; maɪˋnut]

sentences.english: It takes me ten minutes to walk to work.
sentences.chinese: 我步行上班要用十分钟。

sentences.english: The train arrived at four minutes past eight.
sentences.chinese: 火车于八点零四分到达。

sentences.english: He returned a few minutes later.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他回来了。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the car in five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 五分钟后我在车那儿和你见面。

sentences.english: Sam thought for a minute, then smiled at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆想了一下，然后冲着他的兄弟笑了。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour

name: top
trans: n. 顶部，顶端；上部；首席；陀螺
adj. 最高的，顶上的；头等的
vt. 超越，超过；给…加盖；达到…的顶端
vi. 高出，超越；结束；达到顶点

sentences.english: a low wooden table with a glass top
sentences.chinese: 玻璃桌面的矮木桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 顶部，顶端；上部；首席；陀螺
detailed_translations.english: the highest part of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 高出，超越；结束；达到顶点
detailed_translations.english: to be higher than a particular amount
nearest to the top of something

sentences.english: the highest mountain in Austria
sentences.chinese: 奥地利最高的山

sentences.english: the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 落基山脉

sentences.english: a steep mountain road
sentences.chinese: 陡峭的山路

sentences.english: magnificent mountain ranges
sentences.chinese: 雄伟的山脉

sentences.english: snow-capped mountain peaks
sentences.chinese: 白雪覆盖的山峰

sentences.english: a mountain rescue team
sentences.chinese: 山地营救队

sentences.english: She was the first British woman to climb the mountain .
sentences.chinese: 她是攀登这座山峰的第一位英国女子。

detailed_translations.english: a very high hill

sentences.english: The boy ate several dishfuls of ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 那小男孩吃了好几满盘冰淇淋。

sentences.english: They cut the cake in two and ate half each.
sentences.chinese: 他们把蛋糕分成两块，每人吃半块。

sentences.english: He nibbled away the apple peel, then ate the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 他先慢慢地咬去苹果皮，然后再吃果肉。

name: plant
trans: n. 工厂，车间；植物；设备；庄稼
vt. 种植；培养；栽培；安置

sentences.english: Don’t forget to water the plants.
sentences.chinese: 别忘记给植物浇水。

sentences.english: a huge chemical plant
sentences.chinese: 一座大型化工厂

sentences.english: Residents have helped us plant trees.
sentences.chinese: 居民们帮助我们种了树。

detailed_translations.english: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow

name: had
trans: v. 有；吃；得到（动词have的过去式和过去分词）
aux. 已经（用于过去完成时和过去完成进行时）

detailed_translations.chinese: 得病（例如 had a cold 得了感冒）

sentences.english: Our guests have arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我们的客人到了。

sentences.english: Has anyone phoned?
sentences.chinese: 有人打过电话来吗？

sentences.english: We’ve been spending too much money.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经花掉太多钱了。

sentences.english: I hadn’t seen him for 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 我已经15年没见他了。

sentences.english: ‘I hope you’ve read the instructions.’ ‘Yes, of course I have.’
sentences.chinese: “我希望你已经看过使用说明了。”“当然看过了。”

sentences.english: You haven’t done much, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你没做多少，是吗？

sentences.english: They used to have a Mercedes Benz.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾经拥有一辆奔驰汽车。

sentences.english: She sat down and had another drink.
sentences.chinese: 她坐下来又喝了一杯。

detailed_translations.chinese: （与过去分词连用构成完成时）
detailed_translations.english: used with past participles to form perfect tenses
used to say that someone owns something or that it is available for them to use

detailed_translations.chinese: 等于enjoy oneself/have fun(doing sth)玩得痛快

name: bought
trans: v. 买（buy的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: She bought an English dictionary for me.
sentences.chinese: 她给我买了一本英语词典。

sentences.english: I bought the car from the store for cash.
sentences.chinese: 我用现金从这家商店买下这辆汽车。

sentences.english: We stood in with him who bought us the meals.
sentences.chinese: 他为我们买回了吃的，大家分摊了那笔钱。

name: wore
trans: v. 穿（衣服等）；戴（首饰等）；装着（wear的过去式）

name: go on a trip
trans: 去旅行；进行旅行；去旅游

name: ice
trans: n. 冰；冰淇淋；矜持；（俚）钻石

sentences.english: I did not tell you this at first because I was with you.
sentences.chinese: 我起先没有将这事告诉你们，因为我与你们同在。

name: fell
trans: n. [林] 一季所伐的木材；折缝；兽皮
v. 掉下；摔倒；下垂；变坏（fall的过去式）

sentences.english: More than 100 trees were felled in just over an hour.
sentences.chinese: 短短一个多小时100多棵树就被砍倒了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut down a tree

name: fall over
trans: na. 倒了；落在地上；(计算机)程序停止运行；跌倒

sentences.english: If he drinks more than two glasses of wine he falls over.
sentences.chinese: 如果他喝酒超过两杯就会倒下。

detailed_translations.english: If a person or object that is standing falls over, they accidentally move from their upright position so that they are then lying on the ground or on the surface supporting them

name: hurt
trans: n. 痛苦；危害；痛苦的原因
vt. 使受伤；损害；使疼痛；使痛心
adj. 受伤的；痛苦的；受损的
vi. 感到疼痛；有坏处；带来痛苦

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

name: able
trans: adj. 能；[经管] 有能力的；能干的

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

sentences.english: one of my more able students
sentences.chinese: 我班上能力比较强的学生之一

detailed_translations.english: to have the skill, strength, knowledge etc needed to do something

sentences.english: I’ve always wanted to be able to speak Japanese.
sentences.chinese: 我一直想学会讲日语。

detailed_translations.english: have enough freedom, power, time, or money to do something

sentences.english: The children skated on the frozen pond.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在结冰的池塘上滑冰。

detailed_translations.english: to move on skates
one of a pair of boots with metal blades on the bottom, for moving quickly on ice

sentences.english: The weather became warmer.
sentences.chinese: 天气变暖和了。

sentences.english: Slowly my eyes became accustomed to the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛渐渐适应了黑暗。

sentences.english: Helen became increasingly anxious about her husband’s strange behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 海伦越来越担心她丈夫的反常行为。

sentences.english: Pollution from cars has become a major problem.
sentences.chinese: 汽车污染已成为严重的问题。

sentences.english: When did you first want to become a teacher?
sentences.chinese: 你最早是什么时候想要当一名教师的？

detailed_translations.english: to start to have a feeling or quality, or to start to develop into something

name: gold
trans: adj. 金的，金制的；金色的

sentences.english: solid gold watches
sentences.chinese: 纯金手表

sentences.english: gold watch/chain/ring etc
sentences.chinese: 金表/链/戒指 等

detailed_translations.english: a valuable soft yellow metal that is used to make coins, jewellery etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Au
made of gold

sentences.english: They moved to a new house some time ago (=  a fairly long time ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。

sentences.english: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
sentences.chinese: 不久前，我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

detailed_translations.english: used to show how far back in the past something happened

name: magic
trans: adj. 不可思议的；有魔力的；魔术的

sentences.english: a book of magic spells
sentences.chinese: 一本关于魔法的书

sentences.english: a magic sword
sentences.chinese: 一把魔剑

detailed_translations.english: in stories, a magic word or object has special powers that make the person using it able to do impossible things
the power to make impossible things happen by saying special words or doing special actions

name: woman
trans: n. 妇女；女性；成年女子

sentences.english: I was talking to a woman I met on the flight.
sentences.chinese: 我正和一个在飞机上认识的女子交谈。

sentences.english: married women
sentences.chinese: 已婚妇女

sentences.english: a popular women’s magazine
sentences.chinese: 一本受欢迎的女性杂志

sentences.english: When a woman is pregnant, the levels of hormones in her body change.
sentences.chinese: 女人怀孕时，体内的荷尔蒙水平会发生变化。

detailed_translations.english: an adult female person

name: real
trans: adj. 实际的；真实的；实在的

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: bad
trans: adj. 坏的；严重的；劣质的
adv. 很，非常；坏地；邪恶地

sentences.english: I have some bad news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有坏消息要告诉你。

sentences.english: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
sentences.chinese: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。

sentences.english: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好，飞机延误了好几个小时。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 坏习惯很难改。

sentences.english: a bad smell
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or likely to cause problems

name: took
trans: v. 拿；取；接受（take的过去式）

sentences.english: Go away!
sentences.chinese: 走开！

sentences.english: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
sentences.chinese: 黛娜一边哭一边慢慢地开车走了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person

name: leaves
trans: v. 离开（leave的第三人称单数）

name: only
trans: adj. 唯一的，仅有的；最合适的

sentences.english: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
sentences.chinese: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。

sentences.english: There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.english: It’s only eight o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 才8点钟。

sentences.english: I was the only woman there.
sentences.chinese: 我是那里唯一的女性。

detailed_translations.english: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

name: painting
trans: v. 绘画（paint的ing形式）；涂色于

sentences.english: a collection of valuable paintings
sentences.chinese: 一批珍贵的画作

sentences.english: Can you help me hang this painting (= put it on a wall ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我把这幅画挂起来好吗？

sentences.english: painting and decorating
sentences.chinese: 油漆和装潢

detailed_translations.english: a picture that has been painted

name: angry
trans: adj. 生气的；愤怒的；狂暴的；（伤口等）发炎的

sentences.english: I was angry because he hadn’t told me his plans.
sentences.chinese: 我很生气，因为他没有告诉我他的计划。

sentences.english: He was beginning to get angry .
sentences.chinese: 他开始发脾气了。

sentences.english: His comments brought an angry response from opposition politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。

sentences.english: ‘Calm down,’ she said, looking at his angry face.
sentences.chinese: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

sentences.english: Jesse laughed, which made me even angrier .
sentences.chinese: 杰西笑了起来，这令我更加恼火。

detailed_translations.english: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

name: said
trans: v. 说（say的过去式和过去分词）

name: doll
trans: n. 洋娃娃；玩偶；无头脑的美丽女人
vt. 把…打扮得花枝招展

sentences.english: a small wooden doll
sentences.chinese: 一个小木玩偶

detailed_translations.chinese: 洋娃娃；玩偶；无头脑的美丽女人
detailed_translations.english: a child’s toy that looks like a small person or baby

sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

name: lost
trans: adj. 失去的；丧失的；迷惑的
v. 遗失（lose的过去分词）；失败

sentences.english: ‘Are you lost?’ the driver asked.
sentences.chinese: “你迷路了吗？”司机问道。

sentences.english: I got thoroughly lost on the way here.
sentences.chinese: 我来这里时完全迷了路。

sentences.english: a lost child
sentences.chinese: 一个走失的孩子

detailed_translations.english: if you are lost, you do not know where you are and are unable to find your way somewhere

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: key
trans: n. （打字机等的）键；关键；钥匙
vt. 键入；锁上；调节…的音调；提供线索

sentences.english: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 他的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

sentences.english: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
sentences.chinese: 按退出键退出。

sentences.english: Check your answers in the key at the back of the book.
sentences.chinese: 用书后的解答核对答案。

detailed_translations.english: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

name: look for
trans: v. 寻找；探索；渴望；盼望

sentences.english: "What should I look for"?
sentences.chinese: 是要我寻找什么吗？

sentences.english: Not only this will happen but you will also look for his slightest mistakes then use them as proofs for what you have been told about him!!
sentences.chinese: 不仅这个将会发生，而且你也会寻找他最轻微的错误，然后将此作为他人告诉你他是怎么样的人的证据。

sentences.english: " so we can look for those features.
sentences.chinese: 这样我们就可以寻找那些特征。

name: when
trans: conj. 考虑到；既然；当…时；在…时；如果
n. 时间，时候；日期；场合
adv. 什么时候，何时；（用于时间的表达方式之后）在那时；其时；当时

sentences.english: When are we leaving?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候走？

sentences.english: When did you first meet Dr Darnall?
sentences.chinese: 你是什么时候认识达纳尔博士的？

sentences.english: When will the work be finished?
sentences.chinese: 这项工作什么时候完成？

sentences.english: I don’t know when I’ll see her again.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道何时才能再见到她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑到；既然；当…时；在…时；如果
什么时候，何时；（用于时间的表达方式之后）在那时；其时；当时
detailed_translations.english: at what time

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: won
trans: vt. 赢得（win的过去式和过去分词）

name: gold
trans: adj. 金的，金制的；金色的

sentences.english: solid gold watches
sentences.chinese: 纯金手表

sentences.english: gold watch/chain/ring etc
sentences.chinese: 金表/链/戒指 等

detailed_translations.english: a valuable soft yellow metal that is used to make coins, jewellery etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Au
made of gold

name: cup
trans: vt. 使成杯状；为…拔火罐

sentences.english: Mathew picked up the cup and sipped his coffee.
sentences.chinese: 马修拿起杯子抿了口咖啡。

sentences.english: She put her cup and saucer down on the table.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯碟放到桌上。

sentences.english: Breakfast consisted of half a cup of milk and a dry biscuit.
sentences.chinese: 早餐是半杯牛奶和一片干饼干。

sentences.english: The president of the club came to present the cup to the winners.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部主席来给获胜者颁发奖杯。

detailed_translations.english: a small round container, usually with a handle, that you use to drink tea, coffee etc

name: flute
trans: n. 长笛；【工程设计】(刀具的)出屑槽

sentences.english: The boy trilled on a flute.
sentences.chinese: 男孩在长笛上吹颤音。

sentences.english: He played a nice tune on the flute.
sentences.chinese: 他吹奏了一首优美的笛子曲。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a thin pipe, that you play by holding it across your lips, blowing over a hole, and pressing down buttons with your fingers

name: practise
trans: vi. 练习，实践；实施，实行；从事
vt. 练习，实践；实施，实行

sentences.english: They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。

sentences.english: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
sentences.chinese: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

detailed_translations.english: to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test

name: took
trans: v. 拿；取；接受（take的过去式）

name: look
trans: vt. 看；期待；注意；面向；看上去像
vi. 看；看起来；注意；面向

sentences.english: We sneaked out while Jessie’s mom wasn’t looking.
sentences.chinese: 我们趁杰茜的妈妈没有看到，偷偷地溜了出去。

sentences.english: If you look carefully you can see that the painting represents a human figure.
sentences.chinese: 如果仔细看，就会看出画上是一个人形。

sentences.english: Gina covered her eyes, afraid to look.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜捂住眼睛，不敢看。

sentences.english: Let me have a look at that – I think it’s mine.
sentences.chinese: 让我看一下那个东西——我想它是我的。

detailed_translations.english: to turn your eyes towards something, so that you can see it
an act of looking at something

name: happen
trans: vi. 发生；碰巧；偶然遇到

sentences.english: When did the accident happen?
sentences.chinese: 事故什么时候发生的？

sentences.english: It’s impossible to predict what will happen next.
sentences.chinese: 不可能预测接下来会发生什么。

sentences.english: She carried on as if nothing had happened.
sentences.chinese: 她继续干，似乎什么都未曾发生。

sentences.english: This was bound to happen sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 这事注定早晚会发生。

sentences.english: This kind of thing happens all the time.
sentences.chinese: 这种事一直在发生。

sentences.english: As it happens, I know someone who might be able to help.
sentences.chinese: 真巧，我正好认识一个人，这个人也许帮得上忙。

sentences.english: We happened to discover we had a friend in common.
sentences.chinese: 我们碰巧发现我们有个共同的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: when something happens, there is an event, especially one that is not planned

name: fall off
trans: na. 下降；(从马上)掉下来；扫兴颓丧；离开

sentences.english: When your exhaust pipe falls off, you have to replace it.
sentences.chinese: 当你的排气管脱落时，你只能更换它。

detailed_translations.english: If something falls off, it separates from the thing to which it was attached and moves toward the ground

name: thirsty
trans: adj. 口渴的，口干的；渴望的，热望的

sentences.english: Can I have a glass of water? I’m really thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 我能喝一杯水吗？ 我太渴了。

sentences.english: He’d been working in the garden and was very hot and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在花园里干活，又热又渴。

sentences.english: All this digging is thirsty work (= work that makes you want a drink ) .
sentences.chinese: 这种挖地的活干了让人口渴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口渴的，口干的；渴望的，热望的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want or need a drink

name: water
trans: n. 水；海水；雨水；海域，大片的水
vt. 使湿；供以水；给…浇水

sentences.english: There’s water all over the bathroom floor.
sentences.chinese: 浴室地面上都是水。

sentences.english: Does anyone want a drink of water?
sentences.chinese: 有谁想喝杯水吗？

sentences.english: a glass of sparkling mineral water
sentences.chinese: 一杯有气矿泉水

sentences.english: All rooms have hot and cold running water.
sentences.chinese: 所有房间都有冷热自来水供应。

sentences.english: Pour boiling water over the rice and let it soak.
sentences.chinese: 在大米中倒入沸水浸泡。

sentences.english: a fresh water spring
sentences.chinese: 淡水泉

sentences.english: When dealing with a burst pipe, always turn off the water first.
sentences.chinese: 处理破裂水管时，一定要先把水关掉。

sentences.english: contamination of the local water supply
sentences.chinese: 当地供水受到污染

sentences.english: Will you water my houseplants while I’m away?
sentences.chinese: 我不在时你能给我家里的盆栽浇浇水吗？

sentences.english: The garden needs watering daily.
sentences.chinese: 花园每天都需要浇水。

detailed_translations.english: the clear liquid without colour, smell, or taste that falls as rain and that is used for drinking, washing etc
if you water plants or the ground they are growing in, you pour water on them

sentences.english: Oh, what a big watermelon!
sentences.chinese: 喔唷， 这么大的西瓜!

sentences.english: A watermelon is red inside and green outside.
sentences.chinese: 西瓜内红外绿。

sentences.english: This kind of watermelon is remarkable for its size.
sentences.chinese: 这种西瓜个头儿大。

detailed_translations.english: a large round fruit with hard green skin, red flesh, and black seeds

name: carried
trans: v. 保持（carry的过去式和过去分词）；搬运
adj. 被运的；入神的；忘我的

name: bump
trans: vi. 碰撞，撞击；颠簸而行

sentences.english: She has a bump on the back of her head.
sentences.chinese: 她的后脑勺上肿起了一块。

sentences.english: He had a few injuries, mostly bumps and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 他有几处受了伤，大都是肿块和瘀青。

detailed_translations.english: an area of skin that is raised because you have hit it on something
to hit or knock against something

name: hurt
trans: n. 痛苦；危害；痛苦的原因
vt. 使受伤；损害；使疼痛；使痛心
adj. 受伤的；痛苦的；受损的
vi. 感到疼痛；有坏处；带来痛苦

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

sentences.english: Lucy had a bandage round her knee.
sentences.chinese: 露西的膝盖上缠着绷带。

sentences.english: a knee injury
sentences.chinese: 膝伤

detailed_translations.english: the joint that bends in the middle of your leg
to hit someone with your knee

name: cut
trans: n. 伤口；切口；削减；（服装等的）式样；削球；切入
adj. 割下的；雕过的；缩减的
vt. [机] 切割；削减；缩短；刺痛
vi. [机] 切割；相交；切牌；停拍；不出席

sentences.english: Do you want me to cut the cake?
sentences.chinese: 要我切蛋糕吗？

sentences.english: They’re introducing CCTV cameras in an attempt to cut street crime in the area.
sentences.chinese: 为了减少该地区的街头犯罪，他们安装了闭路电视摄像机。

sentences.english: You need to cut the amount of fat and sugar in your diet.
sentences.chinese: 你需要减少饮食中脂肪和糖的摄入量。

sentences.english: Scientists are warning that unless carbon emissions are cut, we could be heading for an environmental catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 科学家警告说如果不减少碳排放量，我们可能会面临环境灾难。

sentences.english: Seven hundred jobs will be lost in order to cut costs and boost profits.
sentences.chinese: 为了降低成本，提高利润，将削减700个职位。

sentences.english: The major aviation companies need to cut prices if they are to compete with budget airlines.
sentences.chinese: 大航空公司如果想和廉价的航空公司竞争，就需要降低价格。

sentences.english: Staffing levels had already been cut to the bone (= reduced to the lowest level possible ) .
sentences.chinese: 人员配备已经削减到了最低限度。

detailed_translations.english: to divide something or separate something from its main part, using scissors, a knife etc

sentences.english: The woman had a ring on her finger, so I assumed she was married.
sentences.chinese: 那女人手指上戴着戒指，因此我猜想她已经结婚了。

sentences.english: We ate with our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我们用手抓着吃。

detailed_translations.english: one of the four long thin parts on your hand, not including your thumb

sentences.english: We arrived early.
sentences.chinese: 我们提早到了。

sentences.english: They must have come home early.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定提早回到家了。

sentences.english: the early morning sunshine
sentences.chinese: 清晨的阳光

detailed_translations.english: before the usual, arranged, or expected time
in the first part of a period of time, event, or process

name: every
trans: adj. 每一的，每个的；每隔…的

sentences.english: His every utterance will be scrutinized.
sentences.chinese: 他说的每句话都会被细查。

sentences.english: She knows every student in the school.
sentences.chinese: 她认识学校里的每一个学生。

sentences.english: The buses go every 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车每隔10分钟发一班车。

detailed_translations.english: used with singular nouns to refer to all the members of a group of things or people

name: during
trans: prep. 在…的时候，在…的期间

sentences.english: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
sentences.chinese: 夏天她当过救生员。

sentences.english: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
sentences.chinese: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。

sentences.english: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

detailed_translations.english: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

name: take
trans: vt. 拿，取；采取；接受（礼物等）；买，花费；耗费（时间等）
n. 捕获量；看法；利益，盈益；（入场券的）售得金额

sentences.english: Will you take the job?
sentences.chinese: 你接受这份工作吗？

sentences.english: Do you take American Express?
sentences.chinese: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？

sentences.english: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你听我的意见，就去看医生。

sentences.english: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls (= telephone calls ) a year.
sentences.chinese: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。

sentences.english: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
sentences.chinese: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。

sentences.english: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
sentences.chinese: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。

sentences.english: I just can’t take any more (= can’t deal with a bad situation any longer ) .
sentences.chinese: 我再也受不了了。

sentences.english: Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.
sentences.chinese: 员工同意接受2%的降薪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拿走； 接受， 接纳
detailed_translations.english: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you

name: medicine
trans: vt. 用药物治疗；给…用药

sentences.english: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
sentences.chinese: 药应放在孩子够不到的地方。

sentences.english: She studied medicine at Johns Hopkins University.
sentences.chinese: 她曾在约翰•霍普金斯大学学医。

sentences.english: the remarkable achievements of modern medicine
sentences.chinese: 现代医学的非凡成就

detailed_translations.english: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink

sentences.english: I will not burden you with a lot of questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不会提许多问题来烦扰你的。

sentences.english: If the Workers' Party comes in at the next election a lot of industry will be stateowned.
sentences.chinese: 如果工党能在下次大选登台执政的话，许多工业将变为国有企业。

name: exercise
trans: n. 运动；练习；运用；操练；礼拜；典礼
vt. 锻炼；练习；使用；使忙碌；使惊恐

sentences.english: Try to fit some regular exercise into your daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 尽量在日常生活中安排一些经常性的锻炼。

sentences.english: Working in an office, I don’t get much exercise.
sentences.chinese: 由于在办公室工作，我很少运动。

sentences.english: role-play exercises
sentences.chinese: 角色扮演练习

sentences.english: Horses need to be exercised regularly.
sentences.chinese: 马需要有规律的训练。

detailed_translations.english: physical activities that you do in order to stay healthy and become stronger
to do sports or other physical activities in order to stay healthy or become stronger; to make an animal do this

name: healthy
trans: adj. 健康的，健全的；有益于健康的

sentences.english: a healthy baby boy
sentences.chinese: 健康的男婴

sentences.english: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
sentences.chinese: 直到现在，我的身体一直非常健康。

sentences.english: a healthy lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 健康的生活方式

detailed_translations.english: physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak

sentences.english: a carton of orange juice
sentences.chinese: 一纸盒橙汁

sentences.english: A Coke and a tomato juice, please.
sentences.chinese: 请来一杯可乐和一杯番茄汁。

detailed_translations.english: the liquid that comes from fruit and vegetables, or a drink that is made from this

sentences.english: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。

sentences.english: Let’s meet at our house before the show.
sentences.chinese: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。

sentences.english: Larry arrived home before me.
sentences.chinese: 拉里在我之前到家。

sentences.english: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。

sentences.english: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.
sentences.chinese: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。

detailed_translations.english: earlier than something or someone

sentences.english: After the war many soldiers stayed in France.
sentences.chinese: 战后，许多士兵留在法国。

sentences.english: I go swimming every day after work.
sentences.chinese: 我每天下班后都去游泳。

sentences.english: Do you believe in life after death?
sentences.chinese: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

sentences.english: The first attack started just after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 刚过午夜，第一波进攻开始了。

sentences.english: David went to bed straight after (=  immediately after  ) supper.
sentences.chinese: 戴维一吃完晚饭就去睡觉了。

sentences.english: After you’d called the police, what did you do?
sentences.chinese: 报警之后，你做了些什么？

sentences.english: Zimmerman changed his name after he left Germany.
sentences.chinese: 齐默尔曼离开德国后改了名字。

sentences.english: People still remember the 1958 revolution and what came after (=  happened after it  ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们依然记得1958年的那场革命和之后发生的事。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular event or time has happened, or when someone has done something

name: toilet
trans: n. 厕所，盥洗室；梳妆，打扮

sentences.english: public toilets
sentences.chinese: 公共厕所

detailed_translations.english: a room or building containing a toilet
